root_causes: Does not enforce numeric range limits (LowerLimit=0, UpperLimit=999) before accumulating values into the autosum.
Cell error flag logic is incorrect: the script unconditionally sets B5cx1_cell_err = 1 (overwriting the intended conditional flag) which will mark all records as cell-error.

Sum accumulation is performed unconditionally for every DO REPEAT iteration (B5cx1_sum = B5cx1_sum + temp_val_b5cx1) even when temp_val_b5cx1 is non-numeric ($SYSMIS) or out-of-range, which can produce incorrect sums or system-missing sums.
Missing explicit check to skip accumulation when NUMBER(v,F12.3) returns system-missing or when the numeric value falls outside the allowed 0..999 range.

SELECT IF used to filter dataset to only error cases. Expected behavior is to list or flag error cases for review, not to permanently subset the file (this changes the dataset for subsequent processing).
instructions: Only set B5cx1_cell_err = 1 when a cell is present but cannot be converted to a valid numeric value OR when the numeric value is outside the allowed range. Remove the unconditional COMPUTE B5cx1_cell_err = 1.

When converting each cell, test that temp_val_b5cx1 is numeric (temp_val_b5cx1 ~= $SYSMIS) AND that temp_val_b5cx1 >= 0 AND temp_val_b5cx1 <= 999 before adding it to B5cx1_sum. Example logic: IF (NOT MISSING(v)) DO IF (temp_val_b5cx1 = $SYSMIS) B5cx1_cell_err = 1. ELSE IF (temp_val_b5cx1 < 0 OR temp_val_b5cx1 > 999) B5cx1_cell_err = 1. ELSE B5cx1_sum = B5cx1_sum + temp_val_b5cx1. END IF.
Ensure NUMBER(v,F12.3) result is tested for $SYSMIS and only valid numeric results are accumulated. Do NOT add temp_val_b5cx1 to the sum when it is $SYSMIS.

If the validation should run when the survey engine indicates 'no DK' via a system-missing B5cDKx1, include MISSING(B5cDKx1) as an acceptable no-DK condition (or document the data format). Example: IF (MISSING(B5cDKx1) OR LENGTH(RTRIM(B5cDKx1)) = 0 OR NUMBER(B5cDKx1,F8.0)=0) B5cDKx1_noDK = 1.

Replace SELECT IF (which subsets the file) with a LIST or WRITE of diagnostic records or create a diagnostic flag variable (e.g., B5cx1_flag = (B5cx1_cell_err = 1 OR B5cx1_sum_err = 1)) so error cases can be reviewed without dropping other records.

Keep the sum-vs-S7_1 comparison with tolerance, but ensure B5cx1_sum is valid (not system-missing) before comparing. Only set B5cx1_sum_err when B5cx1_sum is numeric and ABS(B5cx1_sum - S7_1) > 0.0005.
Optionally, enforce the declared precision by validating that rounded values conform to 3 decimals if required (e.g., use ROUND(temp_val_b5cx1,0.001) for comparisons) before accumulation.
